q_channel_approx.plotting package

Submodules

q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables module

Defines create_observables_comp_basis function along with some helper functions to make it work.

q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables.char2obs(char: str) → Qobj[source]

Returns the one qubit observable corresponding to an observation of char in computational basis

Args:

char (str): one qubit state in computational basis

Returns:

qt.Qobj: the one qubit observable

q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables.create_observables_comp_basis(m: int) → list[Qobj][source]

Create all observables on m qubits (in the single qubit basis).

Args:

m (int): number of qubits.

Returns:

list[qt.Qobj]: list of observables in the single qubit basis.

q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables.str2obs(s: str) → list[Qobj][source]

Create a list of one qubit observables from a string encoding of the one qubit observables

Args:

s (str): encoding of single qubit observables

Returns:

list[qt.Qobj]: list of one qubit observables

q_channel_approx.plotting.plot_observables.str2tensor(s: str) → Qobj[source]

Create the observable corresponding to s where s is a string encoding of a state in the single qubit basis.

Args:

s (str): encoding of single qubit observables

Returns:

qt.Qobj: the observables corresponding to s

q_channel_approx.plotting.visualize module

Provides some common plotting routines

Info:

Created on Wed March 13 2024

@author: davidvrchen

q_channel_approx.plotting.visualize.compare_ess(ref: tuple, approx: tuple, labels: list[str])[source]

ref is a tuple (ts, Ess, name), approx is similarly (ts, Ess, name)

q_channel_approx.plotting.visualize.plot_ess(ts, Ess, labels)[source]
q_channel_approx.plotting.visualize.plot_evolution_computational_bs(ts: ndarray, rhoss: list[ndarray]) → axes[source]
q_channel_approx.plotting.visualize.plot_evolution_individual_qs(ts: ndarray, rhoss: list[ndarray]) → axes[source]

Plots the evolution of all rhos as a function of ts with some basic formatting.

Args:

ts (np.ndarray): times t_i rhoss (list[np.ndarray]): list of rho evolutions (for each rhos: rho_i at time t_i
